author: Prue Lewington
title: Style snippets: Dramatic couture collections a lesson in art | The
text:
IT’S always exciting when the Couture collections come around and designers send the most flamboyant creations down the runway.
Last week didn’t disappoint, with architectural gowns that resembled, in some cases, the Frank Gehry Guggenheim Museum, Bilbao. And the art references didn’t stop there.
Designers such as Viktor and Rolf (above), Alexis Mabille and Maison Margiela sent models out wearing deconstructed paintings, giant bows and tapestry designs with landscape scenes that paid homage to styles of impressionism.
John Galliano, for his official return to Paris Couture Week at Margiela, pulled off another feat: getting dramatic doona dresses wrapped-and-strapped around models with trompe l’oeil net make-up.
At the other end of the spectrum, high-society favourites Valentino, Atelier Versace and Christian Dior focused on ankle-grazing silk designs dripping in sequins and feathers.
A model walks the runway during the Maison Margiela show. Picture: Getty Source: Getty Images
SEIDLER STYLE
RETAILER David Lawrence has chosen one of Sydney’s most prestigious addresses for its spring campaign shoot. IMG models Monica Cima and Paige Rivas (pictured) posed up in the foyer of Harry Seidler’s The Cove building. It was so cold on set they used hot water bottles to warm up.
Designer Robert Rigutto says next season’s range is focused on graphic elements. “We have striped wrap skirts which are worthy of any wardrobe,” Rigutto said.
This is his first collection for the label, which has 111 stores around the country.
davidlawrence.com.au
Behind the scenes of the David Lawrence campaign. Source: News Corp Australia
DINNIGAN BACK ON TARGET
Australian designer Collette Dinnigan will return to Target this September with her exclusive lingerie collection, Wild Hearts.
Joining the Designers for Target stable, the range features intricate lace pieces ranging from $15-$45.
“Lingerie is where I first started my career. When
you love something you gravitate towards it,” Dinnigan said.
The 60-piece range is due in stores September 24.
target.com.au/collettedinnigan
The Life With Bird spring collection. Source: News Corp Australia
SPRING’S NEW DRESS CODE
IF you need another reason to get excited about summer, Life With Bird’s latest collection oozes sex appeal. Polished silhouettes come in satins and double-bonded knits that read grown up, not girlie.
Founder Nicholas Van Messner says technology has come a long way since they started the brand 13 years ago. “It’s about exploring what is happening right now — double-knits that have a lot more body, and we’ve always played around with hard and soft fabrics,” he said.
lifewithbird.com
